intro: Gilia purpusii, commonly known as the Purpus' gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are alternate and linear, often with a bluish-green hue. Gilia purpusii plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly hummingbirds and bees, due to its nectar-rich flowers.
